INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Description (1) A childcare institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures that prohibit the following forms of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
(iii)Threats of restraint or seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff slammed youth into the ground. Staff member verbally
threatened to harm youth.
Investigation This complaint was received on 12/7/2022 and jointly investigated with
the DHHS Specialist. The complaint noted the following: Youth A is
currently placed at Lincoln Center. Youth A was slammed into the
ground and verbally threatened by Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1
threatened to "beat his ass" if his cell phone was broken/wet. There
are worms noted to be in the shower.
Youth A was interviewed onsite with the DHHS Specialist on
12/8/2022. Youth A reported he refused to "step down" at his bedtime.
4

He denied having a reason for refusing to step down. Stepping down is
the term used when a youth is going into their room. Youth A reported
he was up from 9:30-11pm that night refusing to go to bed. He
indicated that during this incident he was arguing with the other
residents on his pod, and he ripped up some of their papers. Youth A
reported a staff was mopping up water and Youth A dumped the mop
bucket that was full of water onto the floor in the pod. He reported he
went to the shower and turned on the water to make it slippery as he
thought the staff were going to restrain him. Youth A reported
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were verbally trying to get him to come
out of the shower. Youth A was spreading and spraying water out of
shower onto Supervisor 1 and onto the Pod. The water supply was
then turned off. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 said if his cell phone
was broken, he was going to "beat his ass". Youth A reported
Supervisor 2 tried to pick Youth A up by his feet and Youth A hit the
back of his head on the ground. Youth A indicated he asked
Supervisor 3 for Benadryl for his head and stuffiness. Youth A said he
told Supervisor 3 his head was hurting but did not tell him why it was
hurting. Supervisor 3 got him Ibuprofen. Youth A reported he
eventually went to bed around midnight when the third shift
supervisors came down to the Pod. Youth A denied telling anyone he
hit his head on the ground. Youth A denied being injured or asking to
see the nurse. Youth A reported he completed a grievance form on the
incident but then he took it out and threw it away.
Youth B was interviewed onsite on 12/08/2022 with the DHHS
Specialist. Youth B reported Youth A refused to go to bed on
11/27/2022. He reported that Youth A took out folders and wrapped a
rag on his head. Youth A was being destructive and tearing up other
resident's folders. Security Supervisor A and Supervisor 2 were trying
to get Youth A to go into his room and he would not respond. Peers
were threatening Youth A for his behavior as they were concerned,
they were going to get their stuff taken away. Youth A was being
destructive and ripped up carpet trying to get into the treatment room.
Youth B reported that Youth A is incorrigible and doesn't like to follow
rules. Youth B reported staff removed the chairs from the Pod so that
Youth A could not throw them. Youth B indicated Youth A went to the
shower in the back and turned on the water and put his hand over the
shower head to try and flood the Pod. Youth B reported Supervisor 2
told Youth A to get out of the shower. Youth B reported he turned off
the water to the pod. Youth A held the shower door shut not allowing
anyone to enter the shower. Youth B reported that Supervisors 1 and
2 were present and Youth Worker A. Supervisor 1 was wet, and Youth
A threw a dirty rag at him from inside the shower. Supervisor 1 went
into the shower and tried to restrain Youth A and slipped on the water
and fell on Youth A. Youth B reported Supervisor 1 immediately got up
4

and left after falling on Youth A. Youth B denied Youth A was slammed
into the ground. Youth B reported that Supervisor 2 helped Supervisor
1 up and offered his hand to Youth A to help him up and Youth A
slapped his hand away. Youth B reported Supervisor 1 asked Youth A
if he was okay, and Youth A did not respond. Youth B indicated Youth
A was provided dry clothing. Youth B reported he heard Supervisor 1
say "hope my phone isn't ruined". Youth B denied Youth A was
threatened regarding Supervisor 1’s cell phone. Youth B reported
Supervisor 1 was trying to mop up the water on the pod and Youth A
came and dumped the mop bucket full of water onto the floor. Youth B
reported Youth A was up until midnight banging on doors and tearing
things off the walls.
Youth B said he never saw any staff try to pick up Youth A by his feet.
Youth B never saw Youth A slammed to the ground. Youth B never
heard Youth A complain that his head was hurt.
Security Supervisor A was interviewed onsite with DHHS Specialist on
12/08/22. She has worked at Lincoln Center for three years. Security
Supervisor reported she was on the Pod with Youth Worker A.
Security Supervisor reported she told the residents to go into their
rooms and to not stand in their doorways as it was antagonizing Youth
A. She reported she was watching Youth A to make sure he was not
going to self-harm.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on site with DHHS Specialist on
12/08/2022. Supervisor 1 has been employed with Lincoln Center for 4
years. Supervisor 1 reported he was called to the Pod because Youth
A would not go to bed. Supervisor 1 indicated Youth A had the shower
running and was spraying the water out of the shower. Due to the
water running into the pod they turned off the water. Supervisor 1 was
encouraging Youth A to leave the shower and tried to guide him out of
the shower with his arm. When Supervisor 1 tried to encourage Youth
A to leave the shower Youth A dropped weight and went to the ground
bracing his feet against the wall. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was
sitting on the shower floor banging the shower door to keep others up.
Supervisor 1 indicated when Youth A was banging the shower door,
he had his hand on top of the door to keep Youth A from banging the
door. Supervisor 1 denied attempting to restrain Youth A or falling on
Youth A. Supervisor 1 denied slamming Youth A into the ground.
Supervisor 1 denied seeing Supervisor 2 attempt to restrain Youth A or
fall on him. Supervisor 1 denied Youth A was picked up by his feet or
bumped his head on the ground. Supervisor 1 denied seeing any staff
slam Youth A into the ground. Supervisor 1 denied hearing Youth A
ask for medication or assistance related to his head. Supervisor 1
denied hearing Supervisor 2 make any comment about a cell phone.
4

Supervisor 1 denied making any comment about a cell phone.
Supervisor 1 denied ever threatening Youth A or hearing any other
staff threaten Youth A.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed onsite on 12/08/2022 with DHHS
Specialist. Supervisor 2 has worked at Lincoln Center for 14 years.
Supervisor 2 indicated he received a transmission to Pod G, as Youth
A was throwing water and Supervisor 1 was trying to get Youth A to go
to his room. Youth A was throwing water and said he was going to hurt
himself. Supervisor 2 reported he went to the control room and turned
off the water. When the shower door was opened Youth A dropped to
the floor. Supervisor 2 denied attempting to pick up Youth A or that
Youth A hit his head on the ground. Supervisor 2 denied slamming
Youth A to the ground. Supervisor 2 denied seeing anyone slam Youth
A into the ground. Supervisor 2 denied threatening harm to Youth A or
hearing anyone threaten harm to Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported they
left Youth A alone to self-regulate and he finally went to bed.
Supervisor 3 was phone interviewed on 12/20/2022 with DHHS
Specialist. Supervisor 3 has worked at Lincoln Center for 12 years. He
indicated he works nights and went down to the pod as Youth A was
refusing to step down. Youth A was in the shower stall and told
Supervisor 3 he would not step down. Supervisor 3 told him that was
okay and that he would sit on the pod with him all night. Supervisor 3
reported he and Youth A have a good relationship and that he was
able to encourage him verbally to come out of the shower and clean
up the water. Youth A did comply with coming out of the shower stall
and mopping up the water. Supervisor 3 indicated Youth A requested
a snack and more blankets which were provided. Supervisor 3 does
not recall Youth A asking for Ibuprofen, Benadryl or saying anything
about his head hurting. Supervisor 3 denied any knowledge of Youth A
being slammed into the ground, or hearing that a staff members cell
phone had been damaged.
Therapist 1 was interviewed onsite with DHHS Specialist on
12/08/2022. Therapist 1 is the therapist for Pod G and she has been
employed with Lincoln Center for 4 years. When meeting with Youth A
he reported to Therapist 1 that he wanted to call his worker. Therapist
1 asked if he had told anyone at Lincoln Center about his concerns
and he indicated he had not. Therapist 1 encouraged Youth A to
complete an internal grievance. Therapist 1 reported Youth A called
his worker on Thursday and reported he had been slammed into the
ground and threatened. Therapist 1 reported that Youth A is a
notorious liar. She reported Youth A reported he drank chemicals in
the past and really had not. Youth A had not mentioned to her that he
had hurt his head or needed assistance. Therapist 1 reported Youth A
4

has a lot of behavioral issues and has not moved up at all since being
at Lincoln Center. Therapist 1 further reported that Youth A has a
history of acting up in school and recently stopped taking all his
prescribed medication against doctor and therapist recommendation.
Youth C was interviewed onsite on 12/08/2022 with DHHS Specialist.
Youth C reported Youth A refused to step down and started tearing up
stuff on the Pod. Youth C reported Supervisor 1 came down to the Pod
to try and get Youth A to step down. Youth A then turned on the
shower and Supervisor 1 went into the shower. Youth C reported
Youth A tried to flood the pod and lunged at Supervisor 1. Youth C
reported he never saw any staff slam Youth A to the ground or
threaten him. Youth C denied Supervisor 1 threatened Youth A about
his cell phone.
Youth Worker A was phone interviewed with DHHS Specialist on
12/09/2022. Youth Worker A has worked at Lincoln Center for the past
3 months. Youth Worker A had a difficult time remembering what
happened on the night Youth A refused to go to bed. He provided
vague details and indicated he couldn't really remember as it was a
while ago and a lot of things have happened between now and then.
Youth Worker A reported he was working on the Pod and Youth A
didn't want to step down and he was trying to diffuse him. Youth A was
arguing with peers and ripped up some other peer's folders. The other
residents had been put into their rooms to avoid conflict between the
peers and Youth A. Youth A went into the shower and was trying to get
others wet. Youth Worker A reported Youth A dumped over the mop
bucket that was full of water. Youth Worker A denied seeing Youth A
fall in the shower or hit his head on the ground. Youth Worker A
denied Youth A asked for medication for his head or medical care.
Youth Worker A denied slamming Youth A on the ground or
threatening him. Youth Worker A denied seeing any staff slam Youth
A into the ground or threaten him. Youth Worker A could not recall
which staff came to the Pod to assist with Youth A refusing to go to
bed.
Video review:
This consultant reviewed video footage that shows Supervisor 1,
Supervisor 2, and Youth Worker A on the Pod. Youth Worker A and
Supervisor 1 are mopping up water on the pod. Youth A is hanging in
the doorway of the shower opening and closing the door. At one point
he comes out and is kicking the water they are trying to clean up
towards them. He then goes back into the shower stall and is opening
and closing the door. Supervisor 1 has his hand on the top of the
shower door and is keeping the door from opening and closing
4

repeatedly. The door continues to be pushed open by Youth A with
Supervisor 1's hand on top of the door. Supervisor 2 then holds the
door shut trying to keep it from opening and closing. Supervisor 1 then
opens the door and enters the shower stall, and nothing can be seen.
Supervisor 2 moves to stand in front of the shower door and Youth
Worker A also moves over to the door to be able to see what is
occurring. Youth A is not visible, and Supervisor 1 is not visible inside
the shower. Supervisor 2 is outside the shower and is seen bending
over and Youth A appears to be on the ground inside the shower as
briefly, you can see Youth A’s orange shorts that he is wearing near
the bottom of the shower. A rag is thrown out of the shower onto the
floor. Supervisor 1 then exits the shower and goes into the control
room. Supervisor 2 and Youth Worker A both pick up the mops, the
rag, and move the mop bucket into the control room. Youth A remains
in the shower with the door closed.
Documentation reviewed:
The Interim Director reported an incident report was not completed.
Therefore, an incident report was not reviewed.
Lincoln Center’s Unusual and Critical Incident Report Policy was
reviewed. This policy outlines the criteria and requirements for staff to
complete an unusual incident report and a critical incident report.
Lincoln’s Rule Violation Negative and Self-Defeating Behavior Policy
was reviewed. This policy describes behaviors that are hurtful to youth
and others that are unacceptable in the program. Rule violations are
subject to discipline. A list of rule violations with consequences are
included on the form.
Youth A’s Violation Sheet was reviewed. Youth A’s violations were
listed as continued negative behaviors with consequences of 1 RTP
assignment and one Restitution or Restorative Justice Project.
Analysis There is no evidence to support that Youth A was slammed into the
ground or that he was threatened. All youth and staff interviewed
reported Youth A was not slammed into the ground or threatened, and
the video does not show what occurred when Supervisor 1 entered the
shower. The agency is in compliance with the rule.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: When a youth goes into the shower staff
should not be entering the show for any reason (unless an imminent
safety situation) for the safety of the youth and the worker.
The incident investigated appears to be an out of the ordinary incident
which could fall under the facility’s unusual incident policy. It is highly
4

suggested that an incident report be completed in these circumstances
to allow for the appropriate review by management as well as
communication of the youth’s behaviors to the youth’s therapist, case
worker, etc.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407
Section (3) The facility, including main and accessory structures, shall be
Description maintained so as to prevent and eliminate rodent and insect harborage.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There were worms in the shower.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed onsite with DHHS Specialist on 12/08/2022.
Youth A reported he has been at Lincoln for 4-5 months and there are
black worms in the shower. He reported they have been there the entire
time he was been at Lincoln. Youth A reported the worms are located
inside and outside the shower. Youth A reported he told his therapist,
and she told him to write a grievance. Youth A wrote a grievance and
then later threw it away.
Youth B was interviewed on site with DHHS Specialist on 12/08/2022.
Youth B indicated he has heard there are worms in the back shower,
but he has never seen them. He reported he does not use the back
shower as it is not clean. Youth B has lived at Lincoln Center for the
past two years on Pods C, F and G and reported he has never seen
worms in or outside the shower. He reported he has seen gnats
occasionally.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed onsite with DHHS Specialist on
12/08/2022. Supervisor 1 reported he has never seen worms in or
outside the shower. He reported the youth clean the shower after each
use.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed onsite with DHHS Specialist on
12/08/2022. Supervisor 2 reported the kids say there are worms, but
he has never seen worms in or outside the shower.
Youth C was interviewed onsite with DHHS Specialist on 12/08/2022.
Youth C reported he has never seen worms and only showers in the
front shower. He indicated the back shower is not kept clean.
This consultant and DHHS Specialist inspected the back and front
shower in Pod G. There were no worms inside or outside the showers.
The front shower was visibly cleaner than the back shower which
4

appeared to have a lot of soap scum build up on the inside of the
shower door.
Documentation reviewed:
Environmental Inspection dated 03/2/22 had an A rating with no report
of worms or issues with the showers.
Analysis There is no evidence to support that the agency has worms in the
showers. Youth A reported there are worms inside and outside the
shower but none of the other residents interviewed or supervisors
interviewed have seen worms inside or outside the shower. This writer
did not see any sign of worms when inspecting the inside and outside
of the showers. The agency is in compliance with the rule.
Technical Assistance: Youth should be supervised when cleaning the
showers to ensure the showers are clean and well maintained. Youth
should be assisted with cleaning the showers if needed to ensure the
showers are clean for the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
